levels.name: Fundamentals
levels.description: Essential racing knowledge for beginners and those new to competitive sailing
levels.targetAudience: New racers, junior sailors, recreational sailors transitioning to racing

courses.title: Racing Basics
courses.description: Master the fundamentals of sailboat racing, from rules to race structure. Perfect for sailors new to competitive racing or those wanting a solid foundation.
courses.longDescription: This comprehensive course covers everything you need to know to start racing confidently. Learn the racing rules, understand race structure, master basic tactics, and develop the skills needed to compete at the club level.
whatYouLearn: Understanding the Racing Rules of Sailing (RRS)

lessons.title: What is Sailboat Racing?
lessons.description: Overview of competitive sailing and what makes it exciting

lessons.title: Types of Races
lessons.description: Fleet racing, match racing, team racing, and distance racing explained

lessons.title: Right-of-Way Rules
lessons.description: Learn port/starboard, windward/leeward, and overtaking rules

lessons.title: Mark Room Rules
lessons.description: Understanding overlap, mark room, and proper rounding

lessons.title: The Starting Sequence
lessons.description: Master the 5-4-1-0 minute sequence

lessons.title: Course Types
lessons.description: Windward-leeward, triangle, and distance courses

lessons.title: Starting Basics
lessons.description: Fundamental starting techniques

lessons.title: Upwind Tactics
lessons.description: Basic upwind sailing strategies

lessons.title: Downwind Basics
lessons.description: Introduction to downwind sailing

lessons.title: Understanding Race Documents
lessons.description: Learn to read NOR, Sailing Instructions, and Course Diagrams - the essential documents for every race

instructor.name: Kevin Denney
instructor.bio: NorthU Certified Instructor with 20+ years of racing experience across multiple classes

courses.title: Boat Handling Fundamentals
courses.description: Master essential boat handling skills for racing: tacks, jibes, mark roundings, and speed optimization.

instructor.name: Kevin Denney
instructor.bio: NorthU Certified Instructor with 20+ years of racing experience

levels.name: Intermediate
levels.description: Advanced tactics and strategies for competitive club racing
levels.targetAudience: Club racers, experienced sailors, competitive juniors
levels.prerequisites: Completion of Level 1 or equivalent experience

courses.title: Winning Starts & First Beats
courses.description: Master the critical first moments of every race with proven techniques for reading the line, timing your approach, and executing a winning start.
courses.longDescription: This comprehensive course covers everything you need to know about race starts in sailboat racing. From understanding the starting sequence to advanced positioning strategies, you'll learn the techniques used by top sailors worldwide.
whatYouLearn: Reading line bias and identifying the favored end
Executing precise timed runs to the line
Positioning and defending your spot on the line

lessons.title: Setting the Course
lessons.description: Learn how race committees set the course and what it means for your start strategy

lessons.title: The Starting Sequence
lessons.description: Master the 5-4-1-0 minute sequence with flags and horns

lessons.title: Line Bias Fundamentals
lessons.description: Learn to read the start line and identify which end gives you an advantage

lessons.title: Finding the Favored End
lessons.description: Techniques for determining which end of the line to start from

lessons.title: The Timed Run
lessons.description: Perfect your approach with the timed run technique

lessons.title: Positioning & Defense
lessons.description: Secure and defend your position on the start line

lessons.title: Advanced Starting Strategies
lessons.description: Advanced techniques for different conditions and fleet sizes

instructor.name: Kevin Denney
instructor.bio: NorthU Certified Instructor with 20+ years of racing experience across multiple classes

courses.title: Wind Shift Tactics
courses.description: Read and react to changing wind conditions. Learn to identify shifts, understand persistent vs. oscillating patterns, and make tactical decisions that win races.

courses.title: Downwind Speed
courses.description: Master downwind sailing techniques to maximize speed and gain positions on every run.

courses.title: Race Management
courses.description: Learn to manage your race from start to finish: positioning, fleet management, and strategic decision-making.
whatYouLearn: When to split from the fleet

lessons.title: Advanced Race Documents
lessons.description: Master all 6 document types: NOR, SI, Course Diagram, Amendments, NOTAM, and supplementary documents with scenario-based learning

courses.title: Race Preparation Mastery
courses.description: Complete pre-race preparation from forecast to start line. Master weather analysis, tactical planning, equipment setup, and race document interpretation.
courses.longDescription: This comprehensive course covers everything you need to know to prepare thoroughly for race day. From analyzing weather forecasts and currents to understanding race documents and optimizing your equipment setup, you'll learn the systematic approach used by top sailors to arrive at the start line fully prepared.

lessons.title: Forecast Analysis
lessons.description: Learn to interpret weather forecasts and identify optimal racing windows

lessons.title: Reading Current & Tide
lessons.description: Understand tidal currents and how they affect your race strategy

lessons.title: Predicting Wind Shifts
lessons.description: Identify geographic and thermal wind shifts before they happen

lessons.title: Layline Calculator
lessons.description: Calculate laylines accounting for wind, current, and boat performance

lessons.title: Fleet Positioning
lessons.description: Visualize fleet dynamics and find clear air lanes

lessons.title: Mark Rounding Tactics
lessons.description: Master inside/outside scenarios and approach strategies

lessons.title: Sail Selection
lessons.description: Match your sail inventory to the forecasted conditions

lessons.title: Safety Gear Check
lessons.description: Scenario-based safety equipment decisions

lessons.title: Rig Tuning Basics
lessons.description: Set up your rig for the expected conditions

lessons.title: NOR Essentials
lessons.description: Master the critical elements of the Notice of Race

lessons.title: SI Interpretation
lessons.description: Parse Sailing Instructions for race-critical information

lessons.title: Course Signals
lessons.description: Recognize and respond to course signals and flags

instructor.name: Kevin Denney
instructor.bio: NorthU Certified Instructor with 20+ years of racing experience across multiple classes

courses.title: Launch Phase Strategy
courses.description: Master the critical race morning decisions: wind shifts, starting strategy, first beat planning, and current tactics. Build your pre-race game plan with confidence.
courses.longDescription: This course focuses on the strategic decisions you make in the final hour before racing. Learn to read and predict wind shifts, choose your starting position, plan your first beat approach, and factor in current effects. Each lesson includes interactive simulations and quizzes to reinforce learning.
whatYouLearn: Reading and predicting wind shift patterns
Choosing the favored end and position on the start line
Planning your first beat strategy based on conditions
Factoring current and tides into your tactical decisions
Building contingency plans for when conditions change

lessons.title: Decoding Race Day Wind
lessons.description: Learn to read synoptic charts, identify shift patterns, and build a wind strategy before racing

lessons.title: The Perfect Start
lessons.description: Master line bias, position selection, timing runs, and escape routes for race starts

lessons.title: Winning the First Beat
lessons.description: Side selection, commitment levels, layline strategy, and traffic management for the first beat

lessons.title: Racing in Current
lessons.description: Read current from visual cues, factor tides into laylines, and use current strategically

instructor.name: Kevin Denney
instructor.bio: NorthU Certified Instructor with 20+ years of racing experience across multiple classes

levels.name: Advanced
levels.description: Championship-level tactics and techniques for serious competitors
levels.targetAudience: Championship sailors, Olympic hopefuls, professional racers
levels.prerequisites: Completion of Level 2 or extensive racing experience

courses.title: Advanced Starting Techniques
courses.description: Elite starting techniques used by world champions and Olympic sailors.

courses.title: Tidal Strategy
courses.description: Master tidal currents and use them to your advantage. Essential for racing in tidal venues.

courses.title: Boat Tuning for Performance
courses.description: Optimize your boat's rig tuning for maximum speed in all conditions.

lessons.title: Understanding Shroud Tension
lessons.description: Learn how upper and lower shroud tension affects forestay sag, mast bend, and sail shape

lessons.title: Mast Rake & Helm Balance
lessons.description: Understand how mast rake affects center of effort and helm balance

lessons.title: Mainsail Controls
lessons.description: Master vang, cunningham, and outhaul to control mainsail shape in all conditions

lessons.title: Light Air Setup
lessons.description: Tuning your rig for maximum power in light conditions

lessons.title: Heavy Air Setup
lessons.description: Depowering techniques and rig setup for strong winds

levels.name: Specializations
levels.description: Specialized racing formats and advanced techniques
levels.targetAudience: Specialized racers, team racing enthusiasts, match racing sailors

courses.title: Team Racing Tactics
courses.description: The complete team racing course: from 'What is team racing?' through advanced championship tactics. 10 modules, 30 lessons with interactive 6-boat visualizations based on the World Sailing Call Book 2025-2028.
courses.longDescription: Designed for anyone from complete beginners to experienced fleet racers looking to master team racing. This course follows a pedagogical arc from understanding what a team race looks like, through scoring and rules, to executing complex tactical plays and advanced Call Book scenarios. Every interactive lesson features animated 6-boat course visualizations with blue and red team scenarios.
whatYouLearn: What team racing is and how it differs from fleet, match, and distance racing
Team racing course layouts: S-Course, Digital N, and windward-leeward
3v3 combination scoring, the magic number 10, and all winning/losing combos
RRS Appendix D team racing rule modifications
The umpire system and penalty procedures
World Sailing Call Book decision framework (Sections A-F)
Strategic principles: speed, tactics, and communication
Offensive plays: mark traps, dial-ups, dial-downs, pass-backs, screens
Defensive plays: covering, pairing, and combination protection
Team communication systems and on-water calls
Race phase strategy: starts, mid-race decisions, and endgame
4v4 team racing variations and building a winning program

lessons.title: A Team Race from Start to Finish
lessons.description: Watch a complete team race unfold step by step — from the starting gun to the finish line — and discover what makes this format uniquely exciting

lessons.title: How Team Racing Differs from Other Formats
lessons.description: Compare team racing side-by-side with fleet, match, and distance racing across eight key dimensions

lessons.title: The Spirit of Team Racing
lessons.description: Understand the culture, sportsmanship, and unique camaraderie that defines team racing at every level

lessons.title: Course Layouts: The S-Course and Digital N
lessons.description: Explore the most common team racing course layouts and understand how each shape creates tactical opportunities

lessons.title: Race Committee Organization
lessons.description: Learn how the race committee sets up and runs a team racing event, from course setting to round-robin scheduling

lessons.title: How Teams Prepare Differently
lessons.description: Discover how team racing preparation differs from fleet racing — boat handling drills, role assignments, and practice routines

lessons.title: The Magic Number: How Team Scoring Works
lessons.description: Learn why 10 is the magic number in team racing and how combination scoring turns individual positions into team results

lessons.title: Winning and Losing Combinations
lessons.description: Master all 20 possible combinations in 3v3 team racing and identify the critical cliff-edge combos

lessons.title: Combination Counting on the Water
lessons.description: Test your ability to quickly identify combinations during a race — the essential skill every team racer needs

lessons.title: RRS Appendix D: What Changes?
lessons.description: Understand how Racing Rules of Sailing Appendix D modifies standard rules for team racing — protests, penalties, and umpire authority

lessons.title: The Umpire System
lessons.description: Learn umpire flag signals, penalty types, and how to complete penalties in team racing

lessons.title: Introduction to the Call Book
lessons.description: Get your first look at the World Sailing Call Book — the definitive guide to umpire decisions in team racing

lessons.title: The Three Pillars: Speed, Tactics, Communication
lessons.description: Before learning specific plays, understand the three fundamental pillars that every winning team racing program is built on

lessons.title: Reading the Race: Combination Awareness
lessons.description: Practice identifying race situations, calculating combinations on the fly, and choosing the right tactical response

lessons.title: Communication Systems and Calls
lessons.description: Learn the on-water calls that winning teams use to coordinate combination awareness, plays, and positions

lessons.title: Mark Traps and Slow-Ups
lessons.description: Master the mark trap: slow your opponent at the mark so your teammate can round inside and steal a position

lessons.title: Dial-Ups and Dial-Downs
lessons.description: Force opponents above or below their optimal course to slow them and create opportunities for your teammates

lessons.title: Pass-Backs and Screens
lessons.description: Coordinate position swaps and wind screens to improve your team's combination

lessons.title: Combination Protection
lessons.description: Learn when to protect your winning combination and when to attack for a better one

lessons.title: Covering and Pairing
lessons.description: Master tight covers, loose covers, and the pairing strategy that keeps your opponents locked in losing positions

lessons.title: The Finish: Protecting Your Win
lessons.description: The race isn't won until every boat crosses the finish line — learn how to protect your combination in the final moments

lessons.title: Right of Way and Transitions (Sections A-B)
lessons.description: Deep dive into port/starboard, windward/leeward, and overlap transition scenarios from the Call Book

lessons.title: Mark Room Calls (Section C)
lessons.description: Navigate complex mark-room scenarios at windward marks, leeward marks, and gates

lessons.title: Limitations, Seamanship, and Penalties (Sections D-F)
lessons.description: Master luffing rights, proper course limitations, seamanship obligations, and penalty exoneration scenarios

lessons.title: Pre-Start and Start Strategy
lessons.description: Learn coordinated team start strategies — from line-up entries to disruption starts that put your opponents on the back foot

lessons.title: Mid-Race Decision Making
lessons.description: Put your skills together: read the race, identify the combination, and choose the right play at each phase

lessons.title: Endgame: The Final Leg
lessons.description: Test your endgame decision-making with scenarios where one wrong move can flip the result

lessons.title: Advanced Call Book Scenarios
lessons.description: Tackle the toughest Call Book scenarios that decide championships — multi-boat interactions, compound penalties, and edge cases

lessons.title: 4v4 Team Racing and Variations
lessons.description: Explore 4v4 team racing where 8 boats race and the magic number changes — plus other team racing formats and variations

lessons.title: Building a Winning Team Racing Program
lessons.description: From practice drills to team selection to regatta strategy — how the top collegiate and club programs build their team racing culture

instructor.name: Kevin Denney
instructor.bio: NorthU Certified Instructor with 20+ years of racing experience across multiple classes

courses.title: Match Racing Mastery
courses.description: One-on-one racing tactics: pre-starts, covering, and psychological warfare.

courses.title: Distance Racing Strategy
courses.description: Long-distance racing tactics: navigation, weather routing, and endurance strategy.

lessons.title: Route Planning & Crew Briefing
lessons.description: Create effective route briefings that align your crew on waypoints, hazards, and decision points

lessons.title: Weather Routing Fundamentals
lessons.description: Master weather routing software, GRIB files, and optimizing your route for forecasted conditions

lessons.title: Offshore Navigation
lessons.description: Navigate safely offshore: chart work, electronic aids, and backup systems

lessons.title: Watch Systems
lessons.description: Set up effective watch rotations for multi-day passages
